intro: Philodendron guadarramanum, commonly known as the Guadarrama philodendron, is a tropical vine native to Central America. It features heart-shaped, dark green leaves with a velvety texture and prominent veins. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistently moist, well-draining soil. Philodendron guadarramanum is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and relatively easy care requirements.
